intro: Vandenboschia schmidiana, commonly known as the African ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with thick, ribbed stems that store water. Its leaves are typically blue-green in color, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid environments and is well adapted to withstand drought conditions.
